VI. Those books, therefore, which were thus delivered to God's Church at first, as His undoubted word and verity, whereby all points of saith and religion are for ever to be ordered, ought still to be retained, and no more to be added to them in either of these two Testaments.

VII. And to know exactly what the true number and names of those books are which belong to them both, there is no safer course to be taken, than herein to follow the public voice and the universal testimony of the same Church; which, from hand to hand receiving those books into the divine and authentic canon of Scripture, hath brought them down from the times of Moses and the prophets to the time of Christ and His Apostles, and so from their time to ours successively in all ages.

VIII.
